definition: (of a smell) strong/peak season (of a crop)/(classifier for the ordinal number of a crop, in the context of multiple harvests)
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: As of Tuesday, the volcano in Iceland was still erupting, though the cloud was lower.
sentences.chinese: 截至周二，冰岛火山仍在喷发，但火山灰云有所降低。

sentences.english: The cometary ejection play a crucial role in formation and evolution of the meteoroid stream.
sentences.chinese: 彗星的喷发速度在流星群的演化过程中起着重要作用。

sentences.english: He tries to catch volcanoes when they are their highest levels of activity, but calculating the ups and downs of the eruptions can take days to complete.
sentences.chinese: 但是考虑到火山喷发，跌宕起伏，须耗时数日。

sentences.english: The plasma flows in a loop along a magnetic field line.
sentences.chinese: 这些等离子体沿着磁力线的方向流动喷发。

sentences.english: The last recorded eruption took place in 1846.
sentences.chinese: 史载最后一次喷发发生于1846年。

sentences.english: The reaction at the surfacealso makes hydrogen sulfide eruptions visible in satellite imagery.
sentences.chinese: 在水表的这一反应也使硫化氢喷发可见于卫星图像。

sentences.english: Ideas come in spurts, until you get frightened.
sentences.chinese: 当你有压力时，主意就会喷发。
火山和间歇喷泉均能喷发。

sentences.english: Currently, the volcanic eruption is not a threat to human health.
sentences.chinese: 目前，火山喷发物对人体健康并不构成威胁。

sentences.english: Pyroclastic flows are some of the most fearsome hazards posed by erupting volcanoes.
sentences.chinese: 火山碎屑流是由火山喷发而引起的最可怕自然灾害。

sentences.english: Icelandic volcanoes have been powerful enough to impact the climate before, Robock noted.
sentences.chinese: 冰岛火山曾经发生过强烈的喷发导致气候变化。

sentences.english: Swanson was in his car driving toward the volcano when it blew.
sentences.chinese: 斯旺森在火山喷发时，正在驶向火山的汽车里。

sentences.english: Old Faithful Geyser erupts approximately every 91 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 老忠实间歇喷泉大约每91分钟喷发一次。

sentences.english: Under-sea volcanoes that erupted millions of years ago formed the islands of Hawaii.
sentences.chinese: 数百万年前喷发的海底火山形成了夏威夷群岛。

sentences.english: Ngorongoro Crater, the world's largest unbroken caldera.
sentences.chinese: 恩戈罗戈罗火山是世界上最大的未喷发火山。

sentences.english: They then use baskets to lug the sulfur out of the volcano, which hasn’t erupted in more than five years.
sentences.chinese: 随后，他们用篮子把硫磺拉出五年多没有喷发的火山。
